| ! [![Pink potion.png](/images/7/79/Pink_potion.png)](/wiki/File:Pink_potion.png) |                                                               |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Name                                                                             | fruit juice                                                   |
| Appearance                                                                       | [random](/wiki/Randomised_appearance "Randomised appearance") |
| Base price                                                                       | 50 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                              |
| Weight                                                                           | 20                                                            |
| Monster use                                                                      | *Will not be used by monsters.*                               |

A **potion of fruit juice** is a type of non-magical [potion](/wiki/Potion "Potion") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, and is juice from the [nameable fruit](/wiki/Nameable_fruit "Nameable fruit").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [3.1 Identification](#Identification)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Messages](#Messages)

- [6 Variants](#Variants)

  - [6.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [6.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)

- [7 References](#References)

## Generation

[Wizards](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard") may be given a potion of fruit juice as any of the three random potions in their starting inventory.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

Potions of fruit juice make up 21⁄500 (4.2%) of all randomly-generated potions.

General [stores](/wiki/Store "Store"), liquor emporiums, delicatessens, and health food stores can sell potions of fruit juice—each item in a delicatessen has a 1⁄20 chance of being a potion of fruit juice, while each item in a health food store has a 1⁄5 chance of being a potion of fruit juice.

Fruit juice can be created from other potions through the following methods:

- Dipping an [amethyst](/wiki/Amethyst "Amethyst") into a [potion of booze](/wiki/Potion_of_booze "Potion of booze") produces fruit juice.
- Dipping a [unicorn horn](/wiki/Unicorn_horn "Unicorn horn") into a [potion of sickness](/wiki/Potion_of_sickness "Potion of sickness") produces fruit juice.
- [Cancelling](/wiki/Cancel "Cancel") a potion of sickness or [see invisible](/wiki/Potion_of_see_invisible "Potion of see invisible") produces fruit juice.
- [Mixing](/wiki/Alchemy "Alchemy") a potion of [healing](/wiki/Potion_of_healing "Potion of healing"), [extra healing](/wiki/Potion_of_extra_healing "Potion of extra healing"), or [full healing](/wiki/Potion_of_full_healing "Potion of full healing") with a potion of sickness can create fruit juice.

[Applying](/wiki/Apply "Apply") a [horn of plenty](/wiki/Horn_of_plenty "Horn of plenty") has a 7⁄500 chance (1.4%) of generating 1-2 potions of fruit juice.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

## Description

[Quaffing](/wiki/Quaffing "Quaffing") a potion of fruit juice raises the [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero")'s [nutrition](/wiki/Nutrition "Nutrition"): the potion grants 10 nutrition if cursed, 20 if uncursed and 30 if blessed. The amount of nutrition given is halved if the potion is [diluted](/wiki/Diluted "Diluted").[\[4\]](#cite_note-4) Quaffing fruit juice does not break [foodless](/wiki/Foodless "Foodless") [conduct](/wiki/Conduct "Conduct")

## Strategy

Potions of fruit juice offer minimal nutrition per unit of [weight](/wiki/Weight "Weight") compared to other [comestibles](/wiki/Comestible "Comestible"), while weighing the same 20 aum as a [food ration](/wiki/Food_ration "Food ration")—most heroes will dliute known fruit juice into [water](/wiki/Potion_of_water "Potion of water"), quaff them immediately, or else use them for [polypiling](/wiki/Polypiling "Polypiling"). In a game where the [smoky potion](/wiki/Smoky_potion "Smoky potion") is fruit juice, players may consider going for [wishes](/wiki/Wish "Wish") by collecting potions of [sickness](/wiki/Potion_of_sickness "Potion of sickness"), [booze](/wiki/Potion_of_booze "Potion of booze"), or [see invisible](/wiki/Potion_of_see_invisible "Potion of see invisible") to turn into fruit juice.

[Foodless](/wiki/Foodless "Foodless") [conduct](/wiki/Conduct "Conduct") players may consider seeking out these potions to maintain their nutrition, and also benefit from alchemizing diluted fruit juice into booze in particular.

### Identification

The [potion of see invisible](/wiki/Potion_of_see_invisible "Potion of see invisible") uses the same [messages](#Messages) as fruit juice when quaffed, making it somewhat difficult to tell them apart. In addition to the [generation rules](#Generation) above, some ways to reliably identify fruit juice and distinguish it from potions of see invisible include:

- Since fruit juice is sold in delicatessens and health food stores, you can narrow down their appearance by dropping a suspected potion of either type on an applicable shop square.
- As mentioned above, dipping a unicorn horn into a potion of sickness turns it into fruit juice, allowing it to reliably be type-[named](/wiki/Named "Named").
- Fruit juice is unaffected by cancellation.
- If you have become hungry within the last few turns and that status disappears upon quaffing one of these potions, that potion is fruit juice.

## History

The potion of fruit juice first appears in Hack 1.21, Hack for PDP-11 and PC/IX Hack, which are all based on [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"). It is included in the initial item list for [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0").

## Messages

The following messages use whatever the [user-specified name](/wiki/Options#fruit "Options") for the fruit is, which is "slime mold" by default.

- This tastes like \<slime mold> juice.

  The potion was blessed or uncursed.

- Yecch! This tastes rotten.

  The potion was cursed.

- This tastes like reconstituted \<slime mold> juice.

  The potion was diluted.

- This tastes like 10% real \<slime mold> juice all-natural beverage.

  You quaffed the potion while [hallucinating](/wiki/Hallucinating "Hallucinating").

- This tastes like 10% real reconstituted \<slime mold> juice all-natural beverage.

  As above, and the potion was diluted.

## Variants

Variants that implement [gem alchemy](/wiki/Gem_alchemy "Gem alchemy") do not change the ability of amethysts to turn booze into fruit juice.

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), mixing a [potion of blood](/wiki/Potion_of_blood "Potion of blood") or a [potion of vampire blood](/wiki/Potion_of_vampire_blood "Potion of vampire blood") with potions of fruit juice will respectively turn the fruit juice into more regular or vampire blood. This also applies to [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM").

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), there is a substitution for [incantifier](/wiki/Incantifier "Incantifier") heroes that gives them [scrolls of food detection](/wiki/Scrolls_of_food_detection "Scrolls of food detection") in place of potions of fruit juice, but there are no roles that are guaranteed to start with fruit juice.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/u\_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 166](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/u_init.c#L166)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/objects.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 813](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/objects.c#L813)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/mkobj.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 2212](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mkobj.c#L2212): *The code chooses a random potion, discarding magical potions; `rnd_class(POT_BOOZE, POT_WATER)` chooses the non-magical potions.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)*
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [src/potion.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 768](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/potion.c#L768)
